alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 7:54PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN SHOWERS WILL IMPACT ELBERT...LAURENS...ABBEVILLE AND GREENWOOD COUNTIES UNTIL 10 PM EST... At 750 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a series of heavy rain showers moving repeatedly northward across the lower Piedmont from Elberton in northeast Georgia to Abbeville, Greenwood, and Laurens in South Carolina. The heaviest showers were producing rainfall at rates of one-half inch per hour, and these heavy showers were affecting some locations that have received in excess of two inches of rainfall today. Locations to be impacted include... Greenwood, Laurens, Abbeville, Elberton, Clinton, Ware Shoals, Calhoun Falls, Ninety Six, Joanna and Due West. The heavy rainfall will create deep ponding of water in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Streams and creeks in the area will continue to rise steadily and some may approach bankfull through 10 pm this evening.
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly.
